description_txt: stated on September 20, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: "A strong bipartisan majority" in the House of Representatives "voted to defund Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on September 27, 2013 in remarks at the White House:
quote_txt: "The United States Senate — Democrats and Republicans — (voted) to keep our government open."

description_txt: stated on September 19, 2013 in a "Tampa Bay Times" op-ed:
quote_txt: "Many state and federal agencies have such ‘navigators’ involved in helping folks maneuver through the often complex processes associated with filing benefits claims, for example -- even buying health insurance."

description_txt: stated on September 23, 2013 in an interview on the John Gambling radio program:
quote_txt: "I would be the first Republican senator elected in New Jersey in 41 years."

description_txt: stated on September 20, 2013 in a statement:
quote_txt: "There are still tens of thousands of missing service members from previous and current conflicts that our nation is working to find and repatriate."

description_txt: stated on August 13, 2013 in a website:
quote_txt: The highest paid employee of the State of Rhode Island is a basketball coach.

description_txt: stated on August 23, 2013 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: If sea levels rise six feet due to climate change, Waterplace Park in Providence and Wickford village would be swamped

description_txt: stated on September 27, 2013 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says Maggie Hassan is the only female governor in the country.

description_txt: stated on September 25, 2013 in a discussion on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: With Obamacare, "we're fixing to get hit with the biggest entitlement program the American taxpayers have ever seen."

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2013 in a roundtable on ABC’s “This Week”:
quote_txt: Under economic sanctions, "now Iran is suffering 30 percent inflation, 20 percent unemployment."

description_txt: stated on September 26, 2013 in a speech about the Affordable Care Act:
quote_txt: "Up to half of all Americans have a pre-existing condition."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2013 in website posting.:
quote_txt: Under Cuccinelli’s tax cut plan, "school divisions across Virginia could be forced to fire over 8,000 teachers."

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2013 in an ABC News interview:
quote_txt: Warren Buffett says stop Obamacare now and start over.

description_txt: stated on September 24, 2013 in a segment of CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: "One out of four corporations doesn't pay a nickel in (federal income) taxes."

description_txt: stated on September 24, 2013 in a Senate floor speech:
quote_txt: UPS left 15,000 employees’ spouses "without health insurance" and told them to, "go on an exchange with no employer subsidy."

description_txt: stated on September 24, 2013 in on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: "(Obamacare) is a bill which has never once had a majority of Americans favor it."

description_txt: stated on September 4, 2013 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Ken Cuccinelli tried to make it more difficult for mothers to obtain divorces.

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2013 in a Republican lieutenant governor candidate forum:
quote_txt: "I’ve been reducing the number of Democratic" Texas Senate committee "chairs since I came in" as lieutenant governor.

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in a column on the party's website:
quote_txt: The 2013-’15 state budget backed by Gov. Scott Walker and Republican lawmakers "left our technical colleges funded at 1989 levels."

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2013 in a Tampa Bay Times op-ed:
quote_txt: "Today many Florida teachers are at risk of having their pay impacted by the performance of children who are not even in their classrooms or subject areas."

description_txt: stated on September 20, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: "According to the Congressional Budget Office, repealing Obamacare would increase the budget deficit."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2013 in a letter to Florida's U.S. senators:
quote_txt: "Over the past 35 years, Florida families have paid into the (National Flood Insurance Program) over $16 billion, four times more than the amount they have received in claim reimbursements."

description_txt: stated on September 22, 2013 in an interview on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama "has amended, delayed, or repealed 19 components of his very own (health care) law."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2013 in an email blast:
quote_txt: The U.S. Supreme Court decided in 1982 that non-citizen children must get free K-12 education.

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2013 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: "Unlike you and me, Congress gets to keep up to $11,000 a year in taxpayer subsidies" under Obamacare.

description_txt: stated on September 20, 2013 in a House address:
quote_txt: If the government shuts down, "all military personnel will continue to serve and accrue pay but will not actually be paid until appropriations are available."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in an interview with CNN's "The Lead with Jake Tapper":
quote_txt: Mental health provisions related to mass shootings "got over 90 votes in the Senate."

description_txt: stated on April 22, 2012 in a news release:
quote_txt: Some "20,000 Delphi salaried retirees lost up to 70 percent of their pensions" as a result of "political favoritism and backroom deals."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: "Thanks to (Rick) Perry's bad budgeting, the (Texas) highway department has to convert some modern paved state roads back to gravel."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2013 in online campaign materials:
quote_txt: "In fiscal year 2011-2012, 4,191 abortions were paid for by taxpayers via the Oregon Health Plan."
